column1: # Heart Disease Prediction Using Logistic Regression

This project implements a **machine learning model** to predict the risk of **10-year coronary heart disease (CHD)** using the Framingham Heart Study dataset. The model uses logistic regression and standard Python data science libraries.

```
heart-disease-prediction/
│
├── heart prediction.py       # Main Python script containing data cleaning, training, evaluation, and visualization
├── framingham.csv            # Original dataset (not included in repo)
├── framingham_cleaned.csv    # Cleaned dataset (generated by the script)
├── heart_prediction_code.csv # CSV containing the Python source code (optional)
├── README.md                 # Project documentation
└── requirements.txt          # Python dependencies
```
- Handles missing values (drop or fill with mean)
- Splits data into training and testing sets
- Logistic Regression model to predict 10-year CHD risk
- Plots for target distribution and trends
- Optional: save Python source code into CSV (`heart_prediction_code.csv`)
- Confusion matrix and model evaluation printed in console
The dataset comes from the **Framingham Heart Study** and contains the following columns:
- `TenYearCHD` — Target variable (1 = develop CHD in 10 years, 0 = otherwise)
> The `education` column is dropped as it is not used in this analysis.
